Package net.nergi.util.lazy

Class LazyReference<T>

Object
LazyReference<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Apparent type of value being lazy-loaded.
public class LazyReference<T>
extends Object
A wrapper for values which allows the values to be lazy-loaded rather than strictly loaded. The intrinsic memory overhead for this class comes from the fact that it itself takes up space, along with a reference to the internal value supplier The lazy-loaded value can throw exceptions, but those will be wrapped with a special exception, LazyLoadException.

Lazy values are only ever loaded once. Every call of get() after the first will load the same instance of the value.

  • Method Details

    • fromCallable

      public static <T> LazyReference<T> fromCallable​(Callable<? extends T> callable)
      Make a lazy-loaded value from a callable object. In general, once can use a callable object directly, or use a lambda instead: 
      () -> value

 or

 () -> {
   ...
   return value;
 }
      Type Parameters:
      T - Apparent type of lazy-loaded value.
      Parameters:
      callable - Callable object to load from.
      Returns:
      Lazy-loader that loads from the given callable.

    • fromSupplier

      public static <T> LazyReference<T> fromSupplier​(Supplier<? extends T> supplier)
      Make a lazy-loaded value from a supplier object. In general, once can use a supplier object directly, or use a lambda instead: 
      () -> value

 or

 () -> {
   ...
   return value;
 }
      Type Parameters:
      T - Apparent type of lazy-loaded value.
      Parameters:
      supplier - Supplier object to load from.
      Returns:
      Lazy-loader that loads from the given supplier.

    • getValue

      public T getValue()
      Lazy-load the value and return it. If an error occurs, a LazyLoadException will be thrown, with the cause exception nested inside.
      Returns:
      The lazily-loaded value. If this has already been called before, gets the already-loaded value.

    • isEvaluated

      public boolean isEvaluated()
      Utility for checking if the object has already been evaluated and loaded.
